headline.main: STRESS MINIMIZED IN A HEART STUDY; Deaths Attributed More to Poverty Than Hard Work

docs.lead_paragraph: The aggressive, hard-driving business executive with myriad responsibilities is not more likely to suffer coronary heart disease than the career clerk, machinist, or night watchman, according to the preliminary findings of a $1-million nationwide study of 260,000 jobholders. The report was made yesterday.
